overview_of_class: This two-course sequence is designed to introduce the skill set required to do physical calculations, using examples drawn from common physics topics. The goal is to develop the ability to calculate efficiently, accurately and quickly, without excessive emphasis on mathematical rigor. The first quarter covers the practical aspects of integral calculus, Infinite series, complex variables, matrices and vector spaces. The second quarter covers probability distributions, differential equations, Fourier analysis, and basics of PDEs.
name: Mathematical Tools for Physical Sciences
title: WCAS PHYSICS 211-1-1 Mathematical Tools for Physical Sciences

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This two-course sequence is designed to introduce the skill set required to do physical calculations, using examples drawn from common physics topics. The goal is to develop the ability to calculate efficiently, accurately and quickly, without excessive emphasis on mathematical rigor. The first quarter covers the practical aspects of integral calculus, Infinite series, complex variables, matrices and vector spaces. The second quarter covers probability distributions, differential equations, Fourier analysis, and basics of PDEs.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: At the end of this two-course sequence, students will be able to set up integrals relevant to physical problems and interpret them; perform operations involving complex quantities; work with matrices and vector spaces; perform Fourier analysis; and solve differential equations.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Three 50-minute lectures weekly, graded homework and/or quiz assignment, possible reading assigments.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Weekly evaluation by homework, quizzes or similar; 1 midterm, and 1 final exam.
